sentences.english: Mr McWhorter, a fellow of the Manhattan Institute, a conservative think-tank, is a hip-hop fan.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，麦克沃特先生本人就是一个嘻哈乐迷。

sentences.english: Fans logon as far away as Finland and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 上线的乐迷有远自芬兰和日本。

sentences.english: Fans packed the hall to see the band.
sentences.chinese: 乐迷为了一睹乐队丰采，把大厅挤得水泄不通。

sentences.english: In classical music, fans believe that opera represents the highest aspirations of the human voice.
sentences.chinese: 古典乐迷认为，歌剧演唱者是最富有情感的人声。

sentences.english: There are enough music fans out there to appreciate this sort of thing.
sentences.chinese: 有足够多的音乐迷欣赏此类物事。

sentences.english: This concert contains language that is not suitable for all audiences.
sentences.chinese: 这场音乐会中所使用的一些语句并不适合所有乐迷。

sentences.english: The fans at the concert were really ape.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会上乐迷们真是如痴如狂。

sentences.english: We are all music fans with a special gene, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 我们都是一些身上带着特殊基因的音乐迷。

sentences.english: And where can the music fans get themselves infatuated in the first-rate symphonies?
sentences.chinese: 乐迷在夏季到哪里欣赏世界一流的交响乐？

definition: (theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances/abbr. for 巡迴演出|巡回演出[xun2 hui2 yan3 chu1]
Cui Jian (1961-), father of Chinese rock music
